Excuse me a moment, darling. CHARNIER's view of the plane interior, walking back towar the rear of the cabin.  The seats are occupied by militar business-government TYPES making the shuttle run.  Not ev seat is filled.  We come to an empty one on which someone has deposited an attache case.  It is the seat next to PIERRE NICOLI, whose hand reaches out to remove it and we follow the arm to NICOLI's face. Close shot of CHARNIER and NICOLI sitting. (DIALOGUE IN
I'm afraid they've become a bit... over-cautious.  Our American friends.
What happens to the schedule?
We must follow it.
But will they? CHARNIER shrugs.
I don't know.  Boca is scared. He's not strong enough.  He sees policemen in his soup.
He is not wrong.
Mmmmm.  That bastard who followed me on the subway, he's the eager one.
Let me take him out. Close of CHARNIER.
There'll be someone else.
What difference does it make? We'll be out of the country Friday. Close shot of CHARNIER alone.

A complex of buildings similar to Lefrak City.  A medium close view of a LITTLE GIRL about to run DOYLE down with two-wheel bicycle.  Two shots ring out in quick successio and tear up the concrete at a point where he would have b walking a moment earlier. DOYLE diving for the cover of a tree.  The rifle goes off third time and MOTHERS begin to scream on the benches of playground area.
(yelling)

Everybody, down!  Get down on the ground! DOYLE behind the tree, pulling his gun out of the ankle holster.  He holds the gun ready and tries to look around Ping, another shot that drives him back. Long panning view, DOYLE's view, from the ground, of all rooftops in the area.  A blank.  The background sound is still screaming crying. "Call the police." "The man's got gun." "Help!  Help!" The view is still slow, careful unde the pressure of the panic.  There's another shot. Long shot of rifle smoke rising from NICOLI's sniper posi Exterior view of the concrete tunnels, DOYLE running from them toward the building, dodging and ducking behind playground equipment and benches as he does.  He's shouti as he runs.
Get down!  It's a sniper.  Get down! Medium shot of DOYLE dashing into the lobby of his buildi to a Spanish kid in the window of building.

Exterior shot of rooftop door opening slowly, DOYLE comin through the opening, gun at the ready. Panning shot of the rooftop, DOYLE's view, stopping for a beat at the rifle and box of cartridges lying beside the parapet, moving on.  The roof's empty.  DOYLE sees NICOLI below, grabs rifle and cartridge. DOYLE running to the parapet, looking over. Shot of the street, traffic, elevated tracks in the dista Long searching look of the streets and the people.  The view, which is DOYLE's, passes over one man in a dark sui stops and goes back.  Zap!  It's NICOLI walking quickly b not in any panic toward the El. DOYLE's face.  He runs to parapet, fires at NICOLI.  Miss DOYLE running across the roof and through the door. DOYLE bursting out of the elevator at the bottom, through crowd of WOMEN and KIDS who scream as they did in the playground. Medium close view of DOYLE running as fast as he can. Medium close shot of the entrance to the El.  DOYLE comin into view from off-camera, running to a stop deciding whi to take.  He runs across the street to the downtown side from which he saw train approaching. DOYLE going over the turnstiles in a leap, gun still in h right hand.

Broad view of platform, DOYLE emerging looking right and DOYLE's view across tracks.  There's NICOLI, standing wit group of people. DOYLE looking up tracks to see if he can get across. Training pulling in an opposite side.  Train pulling in right in front of DOYLE.
Stop that guy.  He's wanted by the police! Side medium close shot of DOYLE turning and plunging back through the doorway of platform exit.

In one corner of the train is a transit policeman.  He's observed Doyle shouting and gesturing at NICOLI who sits nervously aware of the policeman's presence.  Long longs between them.  Finally, the officer decides to approach NICOLI. NICOLI panics and runs.  The officer goes after him and traps him against the door between cars.
Close shot of DOYLE with badge at token booth.
Where's the next stop?  Going into the city?
(glancing out in direction the train was hurtling)
25th Avenue.

NICOLI and the TRANSIT POLICEMAN struggle, as the handful passengers watch.  NICOLI pulls his .45 and clobbers the officer on the side of the head. Close of NICOLI going from one car to another, opening do on the rear, moving through yet another crowd.
Medium close shot of DOYLE running into the street, forci a driver to stop.  DOYLE moving so hard he falls against hood of the car then dashes around to the door and jerks open.
Police! Medium close shot of DOYLE dragging MIDDLE-AGED MALE DRIV out from behind the wheel as he shouts.
What the hell?
(diving behind the wheel)
Police!  Emergency!
DOYLE has a pistol in his hand.  The man falls back sputtering.  DOYLE jams car into gear and it roars off.

NICOLI pounds on the door of the Motorman's cab with his After a long moment - the door cracks open.  Close shot NICOLI pushing his way into the cab of the subway MOTORMA sixtyish, worn and frail looking. MOTORMAN looks down.  He follows the glance to NICOLI's .
Side close view of DOYLE screeching to a stop to avoid plunging into a panel truck.  DOYLE sticks his head out t window to look up at the tracks as the DRIVER of the truc screams.
Blind sonofabitch! Overhead view of the tracks, train roaring along them. DOYLE's view.
The tracks racing by from the view of the train.  We're approaching a station.
NICOLI's close view of the MOTORMAN, the gun on the man.
Don't stop!  Continue on to the next station!
I got to stop.
Touch the brake and I'll blow you in half.
The signal lights are automatic. If I go through a red I'll be automatically braked. The MOTORMAN pales, his hand goes to his left side in a gesture of anxiety, possibly pain.
Side close view of DOYLE screeching to a stop, the car bumping up on the sidewalk and DOYLE plunging out the doo which he leaves hanging open.  He races around the car fo the steps to the El.
Side view of train roaring through the station without stopping.

Medium close shot of CROWD on train pushing toward the MOTORMAN's cab.  They are upset over the missed stop.  Th CONDUCTOR seems to be the most annoyed. He's pushing hardest toward the camera to complain.

Didn't stop. Went right through there... Hey, man, that's my station... Where the hell's he going? Hey, stop the car... Close shot of NICOLI's back, half in the MOTORMAN's cab, he faces the CROWD.  Now the cries turn to:
He's got a gun... The motorman's gone crazy... Oh my God!
Get back.

Hey, you can't... Side view of NICOLI, the MOTORMAN in the background the CONDUCTOR leaping at NICOLI.  NICOLI burns him; one gut s The car turns to pandemonium of screams.  The CONDUCTOR i hurled back into the crowd by force of the blast.  The MOTORMAN throws back his head in fright, and the beginnin of a coronary.
